projects.name: AI-Powered Travel Assistant (AeroAtlas)
projects.description: A full-stack travel planner built with JavaScript that integrates Cesium, GeoApify, openweather API, and Deep Seek chatbot. This is also coming soon and will be available for everyone to use.
projects.purpose: AeroAtlas aims to streamline itinerary planning, optimizing routes, reducing planning effort, and enhancing the travel experience through automation and intelligent suggestions.
projects.team: 5-member team collaboration using Git. Teammates: Alex Canizares, Jacomo Corrieri, Ian Dahlin, Thomas Seife
projects.award: Audience Choice Award at School of Computing Symposium

projects.name: N-Queens Problem Solver
projects.description: A N-queens solver using Genetic Algorithms that is created in python

projects.name: Movie Database System
projects.description: Java modules for parsing and importing movie data into normalized MySQL database

projects.name: Automated JFLAP DFA Generator
projects.description: Python tool converting user input into JFLAP-compatible XML files

projects.name: Website Contact Form
projects.description: Contact form built with HTML and Python for sending emails. Has the Professor Scott Piersall's github, linkedin, discord links

fun_facts: I won the Audience Choice Award for my AeroAtlas project

I created my own JFLAP DFA generator to make automata theory easier
